images.copyright: Surfboards in a row (© plainpicture/Tony Arruza)
images.title: Surfing through history
images.caption: Surfing through history
images.desc: Is there anything more quintessentially Australian than the sand and surf? We didn’t think so either, so with the weather continuing to heat up, there’s no better time to spotlight the humble surfboard. Yet as much as we Australians adore catching waves, surfing’s roots originally lie in pre-modern Hawaii and Polynesia. It is here that the sport was practised by both men and women within all social classes, including royalty and commoners.
